conclusion: To answer how shadows A, B, C, and D will change when the light source moves to the back left or right, factors like position and size of shadows need to be considered.
When the light source moves to the back left, the shadows will shift to the right because the light rays come from the left, casting shadows in the opposite direction.
When the light source moves to the back right, the shadows will shift to the left because the light rays come from the right, casting shadows in the opposite direction.
The size of the shadows depends on the angle of the light rays relative to the objects; as the light source moves further to the sides, the shadows tend to elongate.
A more acute angle (light source closer to the objects from the side) will create longer shadows.
Shadow A corresponds to the clock, located above it.
When the light source moves to the left, Shadow A will move to the right and elongate.
When the light source moves to the right, Shadow A will move to the left and elongate.
Shadow B corresponds to the egg, located above it.
When the light source moves to the left, Shadow B will move to the right and elongate.
When the light source moves to the right, Shadow B will move to the left and elongate.
Shadow C corresponds to the typewriter, located above it.
When the light source moves to the left, Shadow C will move to the right and elongate.
When the light source moves to the right, Shadow C will move to the left and elongate.
Shadow D corresponds to the battery, located above it.
When the light source moves to the left, Shadow D will move to the right and elongate.
When the light source moves to the right, Shadow D will move to the left and elongate.
When the light source moves to the back left, the shadows A, B, C, and D will shift to the right and will generally become longer.
When the light source moves to the back right, the shadows A, B, C, and D will shift to the left and will also generally become longer.
